title: Kylie Jenner plays auto-tuned remix of Rise And Shine for Stormi before she asks for 'Daddy's' song
text:
Kylie Jenner and Stormi both seem to miss Travis Scott.

The makeup mogul got quite the reaction when she played a remixed version of her viral 'song' Rise And Shine for her little one Thursday.

Though Stormi seemed to love the song, seen bobbing up and down and dancing throughout, she surprised her mom when wondering if 'daddy' Travis was the one singing.

Stormi approved! Kylie Jenner shared video of her daughter Stormi dancing to a fan-remixed version of her little Rise And Shine diddy on Thursday

Stomi was sweet and smiley as she wiggled around while dressed in a tie-dye tee shirt from her dad's Astroworld tour while holding onto a phone.

'Yes!' mom Kylie rejoiced behind the camera.

But Stormi may have liked the tune for the wrong reasons.

'Daddy sing?' the one-year-old wondered to mom, who laughed back saying: 'No baby that's mommy!'

Stormi stopped and poked at the phone before wondering again: 'Daddy sing?'

Tie dye for! Stomi was sweet and smiley as she wiggled around while dressed in a tie-dye tee shirt from her dad's Astroworld tour while holding onto a phone

Whoops: Stormi seemed to think it was one of dad Travis' songs and not her mom's

Preferences: 'Oh you want Daddy's singing?' Kylie said, adding: 'I'm not good enough?'

'Oh you want Daddy's singing?' Kylie said, adding: 'I'm not good enough?'

Stormi made her opinion clear as she continued to shuffle around and then tell her mom once more: 'Daddy sing!'

Clearly tickled by Stormi's preferences, Kylie captioned the shot: 'Daddy's girl,' adding both the eye-roll emoji and a heart eyes symbol.

Travis seemed to still be following his estranged other when he chimed in in the comments section.

'Wild,' he wrote back in a comment flanked with two loving emojis.

Total request live: Stormi made her opinion clear as she continued to shuffle around and then tell her mom once more: 'Daddy sing!'

He's still got his eye on her: Travis seemed to still be following his estranged other when he chimed in in the comments section

Reunited: The pair appeared to reunite yesterday, joining forces to take Stormi to the pumpkin patch ahead of Halloween

It seems that Kylie and Travis are on good terms again - or even back together.

The pair appeared to reunite yesterday, joining forces to take Stormi to the pumpkin patch ahead of Halloween.

Though there weren't any photos of the pair together, both stars shared separate Instagrams from what appeared to be the same fall outing with their baby girl.

It was the first time the couple, who announced they were taking time apart back in at the beginning of this month, were seen together in close to two months.

Goes without saying... Earlier in the day she posted a photo of herself as the Sun, with the tongue-in-cheek comment: 'No caption needed'

Winning Voice: Miley Cyrus shared one meme of the reality star fake auditioning for The Voice

Kylie definitely seemed in a good mood as she continued to joke around about her hit online.

Earlier in the day she posted a photo of herself as the Sun, with the tongue-in-cheek comment: 'No caption needed.'

Other celebs were also tickled by the song.

Miley Cyrus seemed obsessed, using her own Instagram to share several Rise And Shine memes.

One showed the reality star fake auditioning for The Voice with the melody, causing coaches Alicia Keys, Blake Shelton and Miley herself to jump up and cheer.

Woo! Kylie's performance caused coaches Alicia Keys, Blake Shelton and Miley herself to jump up and cheer

Rise and shine! Kylie Jenner showed off her secret singing chops as she woke up baby girl Stormi in a small part of her Kylie Cosmetics office tour video

The reality star revealed one of her hidden talents on Instagram Monday, where she was caught serenading her daughter Stormi.

Fans went wild over the clip of Kylie melodically singing 'Rise and shine' to her baby girl, instantly taking to their social media to react.

The clip, which originated from a longer video tour of the Kylie Cosmetics office, began by the star telling the camera it was time to wake Stormi up.

Then she softly sang to her little one, surprising everyone with her vocal talent.

Who knew? Fans went wild over the clip of Kylie melodically singing 'Rise and shine' to her baby girl, instantly taking to their social media to react

Fans couldn't help but joke about Kylie's musical moment online.

And Jenner was so tickled by one creative admirer's work she retweeted their awesome remix of the tune, along with a series of skull emojis signalling the post left her 'dead.'

Another Twitter user shared the clip with a tweet that dubbed the youngest Kardashian/Jenner sister 'a vocalist.'

True talent: One Twitter user shared the clip with a tweet that dubbed the youngest Kardashian/Jenner sister 'a vocalist'

'Can't believe "Rise and Shine" by Kylie Jenner is up for a Grammy! She deserves this!" another joked.

One more fan employed a classic meme, tweeting: 'Alexa, play "Rise and Shine” by Kylie Jenner.'

For some, the quick song snippet was utterly irresistible.

'I have Rise & Shine by Kylie Jenner stuck in my head,' wrote one.

'How do i make kylie jenner singing rise & shine as my alarm sound?' wondered another.

Meme time: There were tons of jokes and memes about the clip on social media

idk why i made this but rise and shine !!!! pic.twitter.com/4BJE6zxasm — mj 💗 (@wubifulangel) October 16, 2019

Some people got creative with their reactions. One fan remixed the moment with auto-tune.

Another went all out with an electronically infused dubstep version of the song.

Though she's certainly got a voice, it doesn't look like Kylie will be branching out into the music industry any time soon.

The entrepreneur focuses her time on running her brand Kylie Cosmetics, as well as collaborating with sister Kendall on their fashion line Kendall & Kylie.

Busy: The entrepreneur won't be stepping into singing anytime soon. She focuses her time on running her brand Kylie Cosmetics, as well as collaborating with sister Kendall on their fashion line Kendall & Kylie

But older sister Kim did once dabble in music, released the forgettable Jam (Turn It Up).

Mom Kris even got in the action with her own track, I Love My Friends, which heavily borrowed from Randy Newman's I Love LA and was released in 1985.

Though mom's track was mostly forgotten, the momager's family didn't hesitate to give their song special treatment.

Her girls lovingly mocked the music video for I Love My Friends in a birthday tribute for mom Kris's 60th birthday in 2015.
description: Kylie Jenner and Stormi both seem to miss Travis Scott.
